heading: What‚Äôs the story?
text: ‚Äôs story, Jackanory? Born Bath, Somerset raised using secret West Country recipe, story mixture Natural Science (Plant Sciences, BSc), Computer Science (MSc & PhD) software engineering. Outside academia, ‚Äôve worked consultant software developer BBC Monitoring, Ford Motor Company National Health Service (NHS). academic, part e-Science lab, Apache Taverna myGrid projects completed postdoc Manchester Institute Biotechnology (MIB) Pathtext project. followed short stint software engineer Chemical Entities Biological Interest (ChEBI) European Bioinformatics Institute (EBI) Cambridge, UK. üß¨üá™üá∫

heading: 2.10 Employability
text:
working hard improve employability students Computer Science necessary jobs, sufficient. (Anonymous 2013; Shadbolt 2016; Fincher Finlay 2016; Fincher, Finlay, Davies 2017) last decade successful doubling number students going year long placements industry around 100 per year, see figure 2.3. win-win-win situation :Students: benefit broader education, develop social non-cognitive skills can challenging teach learn purely academic environment. known winning personality (Vries Rentfrow 2016).Employers: placements cost-effective way employers recruit (retain) graduate talentUniversities: produce better graduates (Mandilaras 2004) broader deeper skills, earn get better jobs (Vries Rentfrow 2016). Well paid placements can also facilitate social mobility. (Wang Crawford 2018)
